the same stack not only can be processed concurrently but will tend to
be synchronised if they have the same dependencies (since they'll be
triggered by consecutive asynchronous RPC messages).

This handles the race by retrying if a concurrent update is detected by
the time the data has been provided to Swift.

Note that this is only guaranteed to result in the latest data being
available on the assumption that a later write to Swift cannot overwrite
an earlier one that has been accepted. This is probably *not* guaranteed
by Swift in the presence of clock skew. Nonetheless, this should
drastically reduce the failure rate.

Similar caveats would probably apply to Zaqar, although Zaqar nominally
provides FIFO queues (in practice, it likely depends on the backend
used). However, with Zaqar clients receive all updates, not just the
latest one, and os-collect-config stores the deployments contained in
every message. Thus, Zaqar is not affected even assuming out-of-order
arrival.

Change-Id: Ic9a447f27e8c51f91f47f93b0fd1e9710341ec38
Closes-Bug: #1731032

commit_message:
Resolve race in providing deployment data to Swift

While we are careful to ensure there are no race conditions in updating
the software deployment metadata in the Heat database, there was no such
protection in place for the actual update of the metadata provided to
the server via Swift. In legacy Heat, this race could only occur when
software deployments were created from the REST API or from separate
stacks deploying software to the same server, because resources in the
same stack were handled by a single thread making synchronous calls to
create the software deployments. However, with convergence, resources in
the same stack not only can be processed concurrently but will tend to
be synchronised if they have the same dependencies (since they'll be
triggered by consecutive asynchronous RPC messages).

This handles the race by retrying if a concurrent update is detected by
the time the data has been provided to Swift.

Note that this is only guaranteed to result in the latest data being
available on the assumption that a later write to Swift cannot overwrite
an earlier one that has been accepted. This is probably *not* guaranteed
by Swift in the presence of clock skew. Nonetheless, this should
drastically reduce the failure rate.

Similar caveats would probably apply to Zaqar, although Zaqar nominally
provides FIFO queues (in practice, it likely depends on the backend
used). However, with Zaqar clients receive all updates, not just the
latest one, and os-collect-config stores the deployments contained in
every message. Thus, Zaqar is not affected even assuming out-of-order
arrival.

Change-Id: Ic9a447f27e8c51f91f47f93b0fd1e9710341ec38
Closes-Bug: #1731032
(cherry picked from commit 46132999c016ed44972b9ac87a53946e9d8a7111)

subject: [www-index] Splits Releases and Languages items
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 16:34:29.000000000', 'files': ['www/templates/dropdown_releases_and_languages.tmpl', 'www/templates/indexbase.tmpl', 'www/static/common/css/bootstrap.css', 'www/static/common/css/combined.css'], 'message': '[www-index] Splits Releases and Languages items

It has not been easy to select language pages on
"More Releases & Languages" dropdown list since
there are many releases (currently, 18).

This patch splits into "More Releases" and "Languages"
dropdown lists by:
- Changing from 9 to 8 for col-lg/md/sm-* in the left part
- Allocating 2 for col-lg/md/sm-* in each dropdown list
- Removing unnecessary dropdown-header part
- Changing on dropdown-menu width from 100% to 150%
  since original "More Releases & Languages" was allocated

Change-Id: I4fd1c345dfd3debd14167839c1b93c69a3d3027e

commit_message:
[www-index] Splits Releases and Languages items

It has not been easy to select language pages on
"More Releases & Languages" dropdown list since
there are many releases (currently, 18).

This patch splits into "More Releases" and "Languages"
dropdown lists by:
- Changing from 9 to 8 for col-lg/md/sm-* in the left part
- Allocating 2 for col-lg/md/sm-* in each dropdown list
- Removing unnecessary dropdown-header part
- Changing on dropdown-menu width from 100% to 150%
  since original "More Releases & Languages" was allocated
  as 3 and the number 3 was changed to 2.

Change-Id: I4fd1c345dfd3debd14167839c1b93c69a3d3027e

commit_message:
Add support for trunk ports and subports

This patch adds support for Neutron's trunks CRUD.
It also adds subport for create/get/delete trunk's sub_ports.

commit_message:
Use ALIAS instead of LABEL for BGPVPN API

ALIAS stopped being relevant and will be removed from neutron-lib, in
favor of LABEL.

This patch replaces one for the other.

For more details see https://review.openstack.org/557691/

Change-Id: I96876caaba1e2663eb0451335327cb1276420d4f

commit_message:
Horizon: Move all config to be directly values driven.

This PS moves all the config files to be directly values driven,
both simplifying over-ride and allowing configs to be targeted
to pods in future work.

Change-Id: I7e16585c9ef49275327d19a48f00bad192dc4923

commit_message:
Cinder: Move all config to be directly values driven.

This PS moves all the config files to be directly values driven,
both simplifying over-ride and allowing configs to be targeted
to pods in future work.

commit_message:
Stop systemd-resolve from booting on our images

It seems with ubuntu-bionic, systemd-resolve boots by default. This is
then overwriting our /etc/resolv.conf file with its nameserver
address.

Change-Id: I3de217505cc0ba18a233e8712be49c5347a8e29b
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I6fe59b462eb976a1291b23ac504912f8c76dbd35
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Install PBR to ensure we're not breaking builds

A new version of PBR was released which causes some services, like
gnocchi, to break in new and exciting ways. This change installs PBR
within the repo_build role which will ensure all of the correct tools
are available to the repo build process and are installed using known
constraints.

Change-Id: Ibf5e3bf0381ec40b1adbe6ce49a5cf7284d3e147
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix failure when adding a speaker to an agent

When get_bgp_speaker_with_advertised_routes() collects the data for BGP
peers, it needs to include the auth_type field, otherwise adding the
speaker to an agent will fail.

(cherry picked from commit fd497a491afec89d4a15cf061b5d5610fb7ad6d2)
Change-Id: I668397be4a531ba5c0628eb23df9a84d0de8c28c
Closes-Bug: 1750121

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2018-02-02 01:24:38.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': "Fix devstack configuration for fwaas v2

We hit an error if you use neutron-legacy and enable 'neutron'

This is required to keep backward-compatibility as long as we

variables derived from it in neutron-legacy are assumed to

", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix devstack configuration for fwaas v2

We hit an error if you use neutron-legacy and enable 'neutron'
devstack plugin. [1] in devstack/settings in the neutron repo
overrides NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF_PATH defined in devstack
lib/neutron.

This is required to keep backward-compatibility as long as we
use neutron-legacy because NEUTRON_CORE_PLUGIN_CONF_PATH and
variables derived from it in neutron-legacy are assumed to
relative and used to access config files inside a repository.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/bc150cdbf8b3af040a61b5b85b0d725e5186ff13/devstack/settings#L8

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I462af133ed8c34448f4ee8593a423b5f0b942da1

commit_message:
add check before adding cpus to cpuset_reserved

There are some cases where None value is set to cpuset_reserved in
InstanceNUMATopology at _numa_fit_instance_cell() function in
hardware.py. However, libvirt driver treat cpuset_reserved value
as an iterate object when it constructs xml configuration.

To avoid a risk to get an error in libvirt driver, this patch adds
a check to see if the value is not None before adding the cpus
for emulator threads.

Conflicts:
        nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

The conflict is due to f0620a01dee1cd98685ec04b3bdef09765cdff61

Change-Id: Iab3d950c4f4138118ac6a9fd98407eaadcb24d9e
Closes-Bug: #1746674
(cherry picked from commit 24d9e06ec68dfd0ead9bc56ad186e7b4e0acd8fb)

commit_message:
Add sphinx_feature_classification as a requirement

This library allows sphinx docs to generate feature matrices. Projects
can now pull this code from a common library.

Change-Id: I3ecea5f6a8b8e6bcfbc34019a2d2652ada8c9c57

commit_message:
Move VMwareAPI virt driver codes to Nova repo

Currently, when we use OVSvApp VC driver,
we need to move OVSvApp codes into Nova repo manually.
This patch set moves them into Nova repo, and also
move config opts to nova/conf/vmware.py.

See:
https://github.com/openstack/networking-vsphere/blob/master/devstack/plugin.sh#L85-L86

Change-Id: I045e36c7b136330db71c2140b1593659fb4a38be

commit_message:
Add disk_minimum_physical_free_space_ratio option to disk filter.

This setting allows us to tell the disk filter "Go ahead and
overcommit disk space, but please at least leave SOME empty space
for instance growth."

Default value is 0, which maintains the former behavior of
scheduling instances on a host with a 100% full drive if
disk_allocation_ratio > 1.0

Change-Id: Iaaecc0b728708c1e89edbd79feec75c842a205d3
Closes-Bug: #1513654

commit_message:
numa: fix an uninitialized local variable

There are two issues: we refer to a variable which can be not
initialized. Normally we should never be in such situation but a race
condition highlighted that case.

The second one is that, currently the code is doing the right pinning
because we go through 'sibling_sets' (plural) in a reverse order. So
'sibling_set' (singular) when initialized is using the group of cores
with the smallest set of siblings: 1 to N.

This patch is fixing the issue by ensuring that sibling_sets is not
empty and passing the group 1 to get the pinning.

Change-Id: I7ea0ecd4ef1436098863e0b3bf6f776fc495d4e3
Closes-bug: #1685226

commit_message:
numa: fix an uninitialized local variable

There are two issues: we refer to a variable which can be not
initialized. Normally we should never be in such situation but a race
condition highlighted that case.

The second one is that, currently the code is doing the right pinning
because we go through 'sibling_sets' (plural) in a reverse order. So
'sibling_set' (singular) when initialized is using the group of cores
with the smallest set of siblings: 1 to N.

This patch is fixing the issue by ensuring that sibling_sets is not
empty and passing the group 1 to get the pinning.

Change-Id: I7ea0ecd4ef1436098863e0b3bf6f776fc495d4e3
Closes-bug: #1685226

commit_message:
Deprecate flavor-rxtx policy

flavor-rxtx is used only by FlavorRxtx controller, which is to
be removed in a future release. This deprecates the flavor-rxtx
policy check, with plans to remove it in a future release.

Change-Id: Icf6d00c9e06e55fb2ba7a52acaf147217f793f5b
Closes-Bug: #1665739

commit_message:
Update help text for encryption provider

The volume encryption provider no longer uses class names.
Instead, 'luks' and 'plain' are used. This patch updates
the help text for the volume encryption provider to use
the new encryption provider format constants.

Change-Id: I2911098505a99658e04ac4008e5f3e857db81f95

commit_message:
vmware: log quality warning on startup

The VMware 3rd party CI has been, for the most part, for at
least the last couple of years, sporadic at best, but usually
non-existent or broken on the changes on which it does report.

Therefore we should log a quality warning on startup that
indicates its low level of testing compared to the other virt
drivers in Nova.

Change-Id: Ic13e39926dda045394c79c33169e81592df86a4e

commit_message:
Integrate oslo.config validator

Adds the oslo configuration file validator as a new entry point.

The config validator is a tool intended for use by operators to validate
their modified configuration files before standing up services in production.

Change-Id: I17f452d3aad58d406974133af93d97c9b8e10f0c
Depends-On: I78d3621afda226f5968963ef408507234dfead4c

so we can later go find those ports and delete them.

", 'number': 7}, {'created': '2017-02-09 14:29:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Stop leaking ports on port_create timeout

Sometimes neutron can take a long time to create a port, as its an
expensive operation at the best of times, and sometimes it can take so
long that the HTTP request times out. Usually this timeout doesn't stop
the port from being created.

To avoid us leaking ports, we move to query neutron for the list of
ports that have the device_id set (this can only be the ones we have
created, at this point), and delete those. This will include the ports
that are created after the timeout succeeds.

Note: the fact the port_create times out, shouldn't mean the list ports
and delete ports calls will also timeout. Of course they could fail, but
we just log that error here. We need to look more generally at a more
careful clean up of resources like ports and volumes when there are
errors during the full lifecycle of the instance.

Closes-Bug: 1603909

Change-Id: Ic8326425d3fbe16408a2d4725921d6bd03f1702e
", 'number': 8}, {'created': '2017-02-09 14:33:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Stop leaking ports on port_create timeout

commit_message:
Stop leaking ports on port_create timeout

Sometimes neutron can take a long time to create a port, as its an
expensive operation at the best of times, and sometimes it can take so
long that the HTTP request times out. Usually this timeout doesn't stop
the port from being created.

To avoid us leaking ports, we move to query neutron for the list of
ports that have the device_id set (this can only be the ones we have
created, at this point), and delete those. This will include the ports
that are created after the timeout succeeds.

Note: the fact the port_create times out, shouldn't mean the list ports
and delete ports calls will also timeout. Of course they could fail, but
we just log that error here. We need to look more generally at a more
careful clean up of resources like ports and volumes when there are
errors during the full lifecycle of the instance.

Closes-Bug: 1603909

Change-Id: Ic8326425d3fbe16408a2d4725921d6bd03f1702e

commit_message:
Resolving volume sync issue before deleting the volumes.

Summary : It is found that after running the test cases(functional)
volumes were leaking and it is not detaching properly due to wrong
api calling as per the expectation so the functional test cases are
failing.  This problem is visible when nova api is used to detach
the volume before deleting the volume. In this scenarios it is
creating sync problem !!So to do the proper cleanup I added
cinder api along with the nova api for detach to resolving sync issue.

currently this is working as a work around solution once actual root cause is found
then this step will be removed

Problem is in the functional test cases execution in
Volume create --> Attach volume with instance
                   --> Detach volume from instance
                          --> Delete volume

Closes-bug: 1613105

Change-Id: Ie85779efeaa6ba11d4695aeb1f516264c75c0933

commit_message:
Add support for per role FFU upgrade

This change adds the option to run the FFU workflow in batches per
roles. The newly introduced workflow first updates the controller
role and then the compute role. In addition it enables running FFU
for compute nodes in a rolling fashion.

Change-Id: I996df8f149ffefe71b20a82cbc979cdc5b3dda11

commit_message:
Work around packaging issue in iptables-services.

When iptables-services is upgraded it restarts the iptables services
which breaks connectivity because it looses the current iptables
rules.

So we add another network workaround.  This time around the
iptables-services package.

The first target is the update process as this is where the problem
should arise, but as the framework for network workaround is already
is place, we cover upgrade as well.

Partial-Bug: #1758291

Change-Id: Ia2f94058bac6cf28b4bd425385ffd629555c9609

commit_message:
deprecate older general configs

deprecate old general configurations

In order to better support the growing list of
supported configurations we need to prune out the
older less tested configurations in src

Configurations required should be documented and
listed in https://docs.openstack.org/tripleo-quickstart/latest/feature-configuration.html

Related-To: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/553892/
Change-Id: I3bd3eb6dfe6a8d769bc5110c43abfb5d76b9de31

commit_message:
Update 'share-pci-between-numa-nodes' spec to reflect reality

Upon implementation, the per-device configuration was deemed preferable
to adding yet more image metadata and flavor extra spec keys. Update the
spec to reflect this change.

Part of bp share-pci-between-numa-nodes

Change-Id: I503e0cd00325daa2f3286aad1e6a2beba7fc6cf9

commit_message:
Revert "Use a common python build/install role for source-base deployment"

This is causing some trouble with the integrated build. For now,
while we work out the role's build/storage delegation, let's revert
this.

This reverts commit 975675b65949042ea7dea108294f0604fb37fd10, except
for the a-r-r entry which is left in place as it will be needed later.

Change-Id: I111baaf1e3d70c036508cccc31887e0f328a67ce
